basics.name: Anatoly Laskaris
basics.label: DevOps/SRE
basics.summary:
Experienced Linux magician, workaholic, and a perfectionist with a passion for technology.

I engineer, implement and maintain resilient highly available infrastructures (cloud and on-premise) using open-source tools and the very best of practices. I'm a big HashiCorp fan and if you use and love Consul, Nomad, Vault or Terraform like I do we will become friends â™¥

I'm also a Gentooman and have a homelab of 6 gentoo boxes running in 3 DC managed by Ansible.

I'm looking to become a better programmer and feel genuinely excited about the possibility of writing in golang or rust in my work time.

work.summary:
Big Data analytics for the third biggest telecom provider in Japan (location based advertisement).

Antiquated infrastructure **refactoring** in the cloud (AWS) and in an on-premise environment (~100 very beefy hosts) with no direct access.

I've joined Cinarra as a junior DevOps and snowballed into a Super Start in 3 years, thanks to the incredible, talented Cinarra folks and unique challenges Softbank provided.

I gave back.

During my time in Cinarra, DevOps team implemented:
highlights: Infrastructure as a code using Ansible, Packer, Nomad and Terraform
Service discovery with Consul - DNS load-balancing
Observability with VictoriaMetrics and Grafana Loki - metric and logs in one place with almost zero operational costs
CI/CD with GitHub Actions using self-hosted runners
Personal PR based dev environment that everyone can use
Secret management with Vault - short lived unique credentials, policy based access and painless mTLS

work.summary: Making ML surveillance system for Governments. My duties were: L1 troubleshooting, incident management and some QA.
highlights: Automation of web application tests with python-selenium

work.summary: Support of accounting app written in COBOL for major UK retailer with ~800 sites running UnixWare. I've been doing tech support over the phone for sites in UK and Republic of Ireland.
highlights: "Have you tried turning it off and on again?"
